sentences.en: "The leaders are outdated," he stated baldly. "They don't relate to young people."
sentences.cn: “这些领导都落伍了，”他直言不讳地说，“他们不了解年轻人的想法。”

sentences.en: An invention may be new toady, but in a few years, it may be outdated.
sentences.cn: 一项发明今天可能新颖, 过几年可能就会过时.

sentences.en: Any compilation becomes outdated nearly as soon as it is printed.
sentences.cn: 任何编纂品几乎一经出版就显得过时.

sentences.en: Caryl Churchill's play about Romania is already outdated.
sentences.cn: 卡里尔·丘吉尔关于罗马尼亚的戏剧已经过时了。

sentences.en: His writing style is now boring and outdated.
sentences.cn: 他的写作风格如今已显得乏味而过时了。

sentences.en: In many places, classrooms are overcrowded and curricula are outdated.
sentences.cn: 许多地方的教室过于拥挤,课程已经过时.

sentences.en: It is dangerous to cling to outdated ideas and theories.
sentences.cn: 坚持过时的观点和理论是很危险的.

sentences.en: Some scientific theories that Mac Diarmid quoted in his long poems are obviously outdated now.
sentences.cn: 麦克迪阿米德在他的长诗中所引用的科学理论现在显然已过时了.

sentences.en: That list of addresses is outdated, many have changed.
sentences.cn: 那个通讯录已经没用了, 许多地址已经改了.

sentences.en: The car has been criticized for its outdated body styling.
sentences.cn: 这种轿车因其过时的车身式样而受到批评。

sentences.en: The image of art theft as a gentleman's crime is outdated.
sentences.cn: 把盗窃艺术品看作是一种绅士犯罪的观念已经过时了。

sentences.en: The special effects are very outdated and look rather laughable now.
sentences.cn: 剧中的特效方面在现在看起来已经非常过时与可笑了.

sentences.en: The tourists snigger at the locals' outdated ways and dress.
sentences.cn: 游客们偷偷地取笑当地人落伍的做法和衣着。
这些数字现在已经过时。

sentences.en: We want to get away from the politics of outdated dogmatism and class confrontation.
sentences.cn: 我们想摒弃过时的教条主义和阶级对抗的政治观点。

sentences.en: Whole areas of libraries fade from use as they become outdated or outmoded.
sentences.cn: 随着图书资料的逐渐陈旧过时,整个图书馆的用处开始退化.

trans.tran_cn: 过时的，旧式的，落伍的，不流行的
trans.tran_en: if something is outdated, it is no longer considered useful or effective, because something more modern exists

trans.tran_cn: 使过时(outdate的过去式和过去分词)
